In order to kill the over-sensitive test yielding  'ERROR in OneLOop dilog2_c', I have commented out
with a '!Val' prefix all the error message of the kind:

if (eunit.gt.0) write(eunit,*) 'ERROR in OneLOop dilog2_c: ' & [...] returning 0'

Andreas will implement a cleaner check on future versions.

Alternatively it would be possible to change the threshold for the trigger with

sed -i 's/eps\ =\ 10\*EPSN/eps\ =\ 0.1\*EPSN/' src/avh/avh_olo.f90
